nodes.bodyText: Haven't been following the changes to the default id prefixes - don't these have too much cardinality to add by default?

We were actually adding the HTTP status by default.
https://github.com/line/armeria/blob/master/core/src/main/java/com/linecorp/armeria/common/metric/MeterIdPrefixFunction.java#L85
And I found an issued that you created. #1981
😆
Perhaps we can add grpc.status only for gRPC metrics. 🤔

Perhaps we can add grpc.status only for gRPC metrics. 🤔

If you meant 'no http.status for gRPC metrics, I guess not because they have meaning at different levels.

Yeah I guess I thought a http status could sort of DOS because of too many statuses, even when health check has less variety. But most servers won't have much variety in normal http status too so it should be ok.
clearDecorators ?

clearRpcDecorator() -> clearRpcDecorators()
Should we make clearDecorators() clear both RPC and non-RPC decorators? 🤔

Should we make clearDecorators() clear both RPC and non-RPC decorators?

That's a good suggestion. Applied. 😉
Ditto - probably less confusing by making clear() clear everything?
I guess this will still be useful for those who want to access the trailers while implementing something at HTTP-level?

nodes.bodyText: Removed the comment. 😄

nodes.bodyText: newParams? 🤔

Could we hide this class from the public API and allow a user specify some functions when calling a static factory method in MeterIdPrefixFunction? GrpcMeterIdPrefixFunction could then become a simple shortcut to that method. (composition over inheritance)
That's a good suggestion. fixed. 😉
Could be private?
Why were these methods removed?

It's because we don't need to expose these APIs to Javadoc reference?
We are overriding this to expose the APIs in the reference but these APIs throw UnsupportedOperationException by AbstractWebClientBuilder which is the super class.
WebClientBuilder which is a subclass of the AbstractWebClientBuilder does not override this method as well. 😉
Time to merge master? 😆
Not related to this PR, how about changing the fallback service name UNKNOWN to none?
This function seems not to be closely related to trailers. How about renaming it to convertToBuf() or something similar.
Fixed. 😉
Question: Is it possible to enable GrpcWebTrailersExtractor only if a RetryClientClient or MetricCollectingClient is configured?
That's a good suggestion. We can actually add the decorator only when RetryClientClient is applied. 😉
How about GrpcWebTrailers and get() and set()?

See the + * License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations + * under the License. + */ + +package com.linecorp.armeria.common.grpc; + +import static java.util.Objects.requireNonNull; + +import javax.annotation.Nullable; + +import com.linecorp.armeria.client.retry.RetryRuleWithContent; +import com.linecorp.armeria.common.AggregatedHttpResponse; +import com.linecorp.armeria.common.HttpHeaders; +import com.linecorp.armeria.common.RequestContext; +import com.linecorp.armeria.common.annotation.UnstableApi; +import com.linecorp.armeria.common.grpc.protocol.GrpcHeaderNames; + +import io.netty.util.AttributeKey; + +/** + * Retrieves gRPC-Web trailers. + */ +@UnstableApi +public final class GrpcWebTrailers { + + private static final AttributeKey GRPC_WEB_TRAILERS = AttributeKey.valueOf( + GrpcWebTrailers.class, "GRPC_WEB_TRAILERS"); + + /** + * Returns the gRPC-Web trailers which was set to the specified {@link RequestContext} using + * {@link #set(RequestContext, HttpHeaders)}. + * + *

A gRPC-Web response does not contain a separated trailers according to the + * + * gRPC-Web spec: + *

    + *
  • Trailers must be the last message of the response.
    • + *
  • Trailers may be sent together with response headers, with no message in the body.
    • + *
+ * That means the response trailers should be pulled out from {@link AggregatedHttpResponse#headers()}} + * or parsed from {@link AggregatedHttpResponse#content()}. + * + *

This method is useful when {@link RetryRuleWithContent} needs {@link GrpcHeaderNames#GRPC_STATUS} + * to decide whether to retry. For example: + * 

{@code
+     * Clients.builder(grpcServerUri)
+     *        .decorator(RetryingClient.newDecorator(
+     *                RetryRuleWithContent.onResponse((ctx, response) -> {
+     *                    // Note that we should aggregate the response to get the trailers.
+     *                    return response.aggregate().thenApply(aggregated -> {
+     *                        HttpHeaders trailers = GrpcWebUtil.get(ctx);

nodes.bodyText: Fixed. 😉

A gRPC-Web response does not contain a separated trailers according to the + * + * gRPC-Web spec: + *

    + *
  • Trailers must be the last message of the response.
    • + *
  • Trailers may be sent together with response headers, with no message in the body.
    • + *
+ * That means the response trailers should be pulled out from {@link AggregatedHttpResponse#headers()}} + * or parsed from {@link AggregatedHttpResponse#content()}. + * + *

This method is useful when {@link RetryRuleWithContent} needs {@link GrpcHeaderNames#GRPC_STATUS} + * to decide whether to retry. For example: + *
